definition: to fail to pay sufficient attention to/to be negligent in regard to/to be lacking in
to dredge/to clear away obstruction/thin/sparse/scanty/distant (relation)/not close/to neglect/negligent/to present a memorial to the Emperor/commentary/annotation
to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]
to neglect to take precautions/relaxed vigilance

sentences.english: He was busy taking notes and didn't make a lot of eye contact with either Romney or the cameras.
sentences.chinese: 他忙于记笔记，疏于与罗姆尼或镜头做眼神交流。

sentences.english: He lost the game because he was out of practice.
sentences.chinese: 他疏于练习，输了这场比赛。

sentences.english: The teacher grew lax about assigning homework as summer vacation drew near.
sentences.chinese: 暑期临近，老师就疏于布置家庭作业了。

sentences.english: But neglected the study of She in regions of scattered or mixed.
sentences.chinese: 而疏于对散居或杂居地区的畲族的研究。

sentences.english: They trim 's sake, inclined to the twisted branches which are coiled, dense, thick.
sentences.chinese: 疏于修剪的缘故，斜出的虬枝盘旋而上，密集，粗壮。

sentences.english: Workers may be discouraged or their skills may decay.
sentences.chinese: 工人可能会气馁或者疏于他们的技术。

definition: not to do one's best/not to exert oneself
to let sb do whatever they want/to indulge/to give free reins to/to let things slide/to drift aimlessly/laissez-faire
to such an extent as to/down to/up to
to abandon (cultivated fields)/no longer cultivated/to lie waste/wasted/to neglect (one's work or study)
old habits are hard to change (idiom)
